sys_metadata_link.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_snc_ollama_genai_prompt"> <x_snc_ollama_genai_prompt action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <apitype>command</apitype> <model>gemma:2b</model> <prompt>Tell me about greatest physicists of Africa?</prompt> <python_script_name>c:\python\OllamaLangchain.py</python_script_name> <response>**Notable Physicists from Africa:**
**1. Albert Luyala (South Africa):** - Pioneer in condensed matter physics, particularly the behavior of complex fluids. - Led a research group at the University of Cape Town and served as the South African representative to the International Association of Physicists.
**2. Nsikumbulo Dlamini (South Africa):** - Theoretical physicist known for his work on string theory and quantum gravity. - Co-recipient of the 2016 Nobel Prize in Physics for his contributions to theoretical physics.
**3. Abdusalam Abdi (Somalia):** - Leading physicist at the Somali Institute of Technology. - Research focuses on nuclear physics, astrophysics, and particle physics.
**4. Olufemi Awolowo (Nigeria):** - Professor of physics and deputy vice-chancellor for research at the University of Nigeria, Lagos. - Research interests include fluid dynamics, plasma physics, and cosmology.
**5. Biko Msimanga (South Africa):** - Physicist and activist who played a significant role in the anti-apartheid movement. - Co-founder of the Desmond Tutu Foundation, which promotes education and empowerment.
**6. Ngugi wa Thiong'o (Kenya):** - Leading physicist at the University of Nairobi. - Research focuses on condensed matter physics, materials science, and computational physics.
**7. Mpho Maphisa (South Africa):** - Theoretical physicist known for his work on cosmology and astrophysics. - Currently serves as a professor of physics at the University of Witwatersrand.
**8. Isaac Shamu (South Africa):** - Physicist and academic administrator at the University of South Africa. - Research interests include high-energy physics, astrophysics, and cosmology.
**9. Yemi Owoye (Nigeria):** - Physicist and entrepreneur who made significant contributions to the development of the African Continental Integrated Transport (ACIT). - Founder of the African Institute for Mathematical, Physical and Engineering Research (AIMPEP).
**10. Chigozi Obioha (Nigeria):** - Theoretical physicist whose research focuses on cosmology, astrophysics, and high-energy physics. - Currently serves as a professor at the University of Lagos.</response> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2024-05-11 09:21:32</sys_created_on> <sys_id>046548ae5cc202107f447a245d4d3d4e</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2024-05-11 09:28:10</sys_updated_on> </x_snc_ollama_genai_prompt> </record_update>
